definition: Toktoghan (1314-1355), Mongol politician during the Yuan dynasty, prime minister until 1345, compiled three dynastic histories of Song 宋史, Liao 遼史|辽史 and Jin 金史/also written Tuoketuo 托克托
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from

sentences.english: The mouse Woods also quietly climbed Tuotuo hereby around, looked up the moon with him.
sentences.chinese: 老鼠嗚茲也默默地爬到脫脫身邊，陪着他擡頭看月亮。

sentences.english: Tuotuo flapped ears and walked away.
sentences.chinese: 脫脫耷拉着耳朵，走開了。

sentences.english: Tuotuo was sitting near the water and watching the moon rise, there was an urge to howl.
sentences.chinese: 脫脫坐在水池邊擡頭看月亮，有一種想嚎叫的衝動。

sentences.english: The subjects had, indeed, risen vividly on my mind.
sentences.chinese: 畫的題材倒確實活脫脫地浮此刻我腦海裏。

sentences.english: Tuotuo has given the face to chewing slowly; chewing was pulpy but hard to swallow.
sentences.chinese: 脫脫很給面子地慢慢嚼着，嚼得稀爛卻難以下嚥。

sentences.english: When she drinks the wine, she will come down from the picture.
sentences.chinese: 飲酒這後，她就會活脫脫地從畫中走出來。

sentences.english: The wars occurred between Timur and Toqtamish could be studied through two different periods.
sentences.chinese: 帖木兒與欽察汗脫脫迷失之間的戰爭分爲兩個階段。

sentences.english: And I often grazed the cattle, living a life like that in fairy tales.
sentences.chinese: 活脫脫一個標準的放牛娃，像童話一樣。

sentences.english: Tuotuo're looking at the moon for Woos said.
sentences.chinese: 脫脫看着月亮對嗚茲說。

definition: to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
lit. not eating the food of common mortals/fig. placing oneself above the common populace
pinyin: bu4 shi2 ren2 jian1 yan1 huo3

definition: universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
lit. able to support both heaven and earth/of indomitable spirit (idiom)
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
